meanings.definition: To make or become wider, larger, or more open.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used eye drops to dilate my pupils during the examination.
meanings.sent2: The flower dilated in the sunlight, blooming beautifully in the garden.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally dilated the hole in my sock while trying to mend it.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement dilated her eyes like saucers as she opened the gift.
meanings.sent5: The hot air balloon dilated in the sky, soaring above the treetops.

meanings.sent1: The dilated balloon floated gracefully in the air at the party.
meanings.sent2: The dilated rubber band snapped loudly when stretched too far.
meanings.sent3: The dilated cat stretched out lazily in the sunbeam, enjoying the warmth.
meanings.sent4: His dilated arms reached out to embrace his friend in a warm hug.
meanings.sent5: The dilated road ahead seemed to go on forever, disappearing into the horizon.
